org.ejvm.execution

Enum EjvmInstruction

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<EjvmInstruction>
      • org.ejvm.execution.EjvmInstruction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<EjvmInstruction>

    public enum EjvmInstruction
extends Enum<EjvmInstruction>

    Contains all instructions executable by the EjvmProcessor. In fact, the actual execution of the instructions is delegated to the execute(EjvmProcess, EjvmProcessor, Number...) method provided by each element of this Enum.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sebastian Nicolai Kaupe
    See Also:
    EjvmInstruction.ArgumentType

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  EjvmInstruction.ArgumentType
      Describes the types arguments to an eJVM instruction may have.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      BIPUSH
      Pushes the 2-byte number literal provided as argument onto the process's stack.
      DUP
      Duplicates the top-most two bytes of the process stack, effectively copying the top-most stack entry.
      ERR
      Halts the EjvmProcessor, referring to an error message via its sole argument.
      GOTO
      Moves the program counter number of bytes it receives as first argument.
      HALT
      Halts the EjvmProcess.
      IADD
      Pops two shorts from the process stack, adds them together and pushes the result back onto the stack.
      IAND
      Pops two shorts from the process stack, applies a binary AND to them and pushes the result back onto the stack.
      IF_ICMPEQ
      Removes the two top-most stack values and compares them.
      IFEQ
      Removes the top-most stack value and checks its value.
      IFLT
      Removes the top-most stack value and checks its value.
      IINC
      Adds its second argument (short literal) onto the local variable/parameter at the index denoted by its first argument.
      ILOAD
      Retrieves the 2-byte value at the index provided as argument from the local variable table (which is itself on the stack) for the currently executed method and pushes it onto the process stack.
      IN
      Attempts to read a single character from the input provided by the processor's EjvmMachine.
      INVOKEVIRTUAL
      Invokes the method denoted by their index in the method table.
      IOR
      Pops two shorts from the process stack, applies a binary OR to them and pushes the result back onto the stack.
      IRETURN
      Returns the control flow to a method invoked earlier, popping a single short value from the current stack frame and places it as new stack value onto the stack of the underlying stack frame.
      ISTORE
      Pops the top-most 2-byte value from the process stack and writes it into the method's local variable table at the index provided as argument.
      ISUB
      Pops two shorts from the process stack, subtracts the second from the first and pushes the result back onto the stack.
      LDC
      Retrieves the constant at the provided index from the process's constant pool and push it onto the the process stack.
      NOP
      This instruction does nothing.
      OUT
      Removes the top-most stack value and formats it according to the processes output format defined by SETOUT, writing it out to the output channel provided by the processor's EjvmMachine.
      POP
      Removes the top-most stack value (two bytes) from the process stack.
      RETURN
      Returns the control flow to a method invoked earlier without returning a value.
      SETOUT
      Sets the output formatter for a process.
      SWAP
      Swaps the two 2-byte values of the process stack.
      WIDE
      Deprecated.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • BIPUSH

        public static final EjvmInstruction BIPUSH

        Pushes the 2-byte number literal provided as argument onto the process's stack.

        Since:
        1.0

      • DUP

        public static final EjvmInstruction DUP

        Duplicates the top-most two bytes of the process stack, effectively copying the top-most stack entry.

        Since:
        1.0

      • POP

        public static final EjvmInstruction POP

        Removes the top-most stack value (two bytes) from the process stack.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        BIPUSH

      • SWAP

        public static final EjvmInstruction SWAP

        Swaps the two 2-byte values of the process stack.

        Since:
        1.0

      • ILOAD

        public static final EjvmInstruction ILOAD

        Retrieves the 2-byte value at the index provided as argument from the local variable table (which is itself on the stack) for the currently executed method and pushes it onto the process stack.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ISTORE

      • ISTORE

        public static final EjvmInstruction ISTORE

        Pops the top-most 2-byte value from the process stack and writes it into the method's local variable table at the index provided as argument.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ILOAD

      • LDC

        public static final EjvmInstruction LDC

        Retrieves the constant at the provided index from the process's constant pool and push it onto the the process stack.

        Since:
        1.0

      • IADD

        public static final EjvmInstruction IADD

        Pops two shorts from the process stack, adds them together and pushes the result back onto the stack.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ISUB, IINC

      • ISUB

        public static final EjvmInstruction ISUB

        Pops two shorts from the process stack, subtracts the second from the first and pushes the result back onto the stack.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IADD, IINC

      • IINC

        public static final EjvmInstruction IINC

        Adds its second argument (short literal) onto the local variable/parameter at the index denoted by its first argument.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IADD, ISUB

      • IAND

        public static final EjvmInstruction IAND

        Pops two shorts from the process stack, applies a binary AND to them and pushes the result back onto the stack.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IOR

      • IOR

        public static final EjvmInstruction IOR

        Pops two shorts from the process stack, applies a binary OR to them and pushes the result back onto the stack.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IAND

      • GOTO

        public static final EjvmInstruction GOTO

        Moves the program counter number of bytes it receives as first argument.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IFEQ, IFLT, IF_ICMPEQ

      • IFEQ

        public static final EjvmInstruction IFEQ

        Removes the top-most stack value and checks its value. If it is 0, the instruction moves the program counter of the process the number of bytes it receives as first argument.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        GOTO, IFLT, IF_ICMPEQ

      • IFLT

        public static final EjvmInstruction IFLT

        Removes the top-most stack value and checks its value. If it lesser than 0, the instruction moves the program counter of the process the number of bytes it receives as first argument.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        GOTO, IFEQ, IF_ICMPEQ

      • IF_ICMPEQ

        public static final EjvmInstruction IF_ICMPEQ

        Removes the two top-most stack values and compares them. If they are equal, the instruction moves the program counter of the process the number of bytes it receives as first argument.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        GOTO, IFEQ, IFLT

      • INVOKEVIRTUAL

        public static final EjvmInstruction INVOKEVIRTUAL

        Invokes the method denoted by their index in the method table. A new stack frame is added to the process for the execution of the invoked method.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        RETURN, IRETURN

      • IRETURN

        public static final EjvmInstruction IRETURN

        Returns the control flow to a method invoked earlier, popping a single short value from the current stack frame and places it as new stack value onto the stack of the underlying stack frame. If their is no such method (i.e. main is complete), the EjvmProcess changes into the EjvmProcess.ProcessState.DONE state.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        INVOKEVIRTUAL

      • RETURN

        public static final EjvmInstruction RETURN

        Returns the control flow to a method invoked earlier without returning a value. If their is no such method (i.e. main is complete), the EjvmProcess changes into the EjvmProcess.ProcessState.DONE state.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        INVOKEVIRTUAL

      • IN

        public static final EjvmInstruction IN

        Attempts to read a single character from the input provided by the processor's EjvmMachine. If no input is available, the instruction sets the process state to EjvmProcess.ProcessState.BLOCKED.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        OUT

      • OUT

        public static final EjvmInstruction OUT

        Removes the top-most stack value and formats it according to the processes output format defined by SETOUT, writing it out to the output channel provided by the processor's EjvmMachine.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IN

      • SETOUT

        public static final EjvmInstruction SETOUT

        Sets the output formatter for a process. The formatter is used to process any output into the format desired by the program's programmer (i.e., numerical or textual output).

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        OUT

      • ERR

        public static final EjvmInstruction ERR

        Halts the EjvmProcessor, referring to an error message via its sole argument. Retrieve the message using an implementation of EjvmExecutionListener.afterExecution(EjvmProcess, EjvmInstruction, Number...).

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        HALT

      • HALT

        public static final EjvmInstruction HALT

        Halts the EjvmProcess. This is not an error halt, but one deliberately requested by the program.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ERR

      • NOP

        public static final EjvmInstruction NOP

        This instruction does nothing.

        Since:
        1.0

      • WIDE

        @Deprecated
public static final EjvmInstruction WIDE
        Deprecated. 

        This instruction was meant for machines working with single-byte values and let the following instruction with 16 instead of 8 bit values. Since this implementation already works with 16 bit short values, this instruction has been deprecated and acts as if NOP would have been invoked.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        NOP

      • values

        public static EjvmInstruction[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (EjvmInstruction c : EjvmInstruction.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static EjvmInstruction valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • getOpCode

        public byte getOpCode()

        Returns the opCode associated with this instruction.

        Returns:
        The opCode for the instruction.

      • getArgumentTypes

        public EjvmInstruction.ArgumentType[] getArgumentTypes()

        Returns an array containing the types of the arguments this instruction expects.

        Returns:
        The arguments types for this instruction.

      • execute

        public abstract void execute(EjvmProcess process,
           EjvmProcessor processor,
           Number... args)

        Executes the instruction with args providing the arguments needed. Arguments should have been converted into their appropriate form using EjvmInstruction.ArgumentType.fromBytes(byte[]).

        Parameters:
        process - The process from which the instruction originates.
        processor - The EjvmProcessor process is executed on.
        args - The arguments needed for the instruction.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - In any case where something is wrong with the parameters, e.g. if their is a wrong number of those or they are of the wrong type.

      • forOpcode

        public static EjvmInstruction forOpcode(byte opCode)

        Fetches the instruction opCode is assigned to.

        Parameters:
        opCode - The OpCode for which the associated instruction is to be fetched.
        Returns:
        The instruction for opCode.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If there is no matching instruction.
